verbs.description: deselect (third-person singular simple present deselects, present participle deselecting, simple past and past participle deselected)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To not select; to rule out of selection.
examples: ACTION may deselect a Trainee out of a training program for any of the following reasons: (a) Failure to meet training selection standards which includes, but is not limited to, the following conduct:  […]

entries.meaning: (transitive, Britain, politics) To reject (an incumbent) as a party's candidate for a forthcoming election.
examples: One recently deselected Sinn Féin assembly member, Davy Hyland in Newry and Armagh, has already quit the party in protest.

entries.meaning: (transitive, graphical user interface) To remove from an existing selection.
examples: Make sure you deselect any files you wish to keep before proceeding with the deletion.
